question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/validator_txns/dkg.rs] [Function: process_dkg_result_inner()] [Storage gas params failure] If storage_gas_params at line 138-139 returns Err, does the Unexpected error propagation at line 142 ensure all validators fail identically, or can some validators succeed while others fail causing consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/validator_txns/dkg.rs] [Function: process_dkg_result_inner()] [Weak randomness] Can attackers exploit weak randomness in DefaultDKG to predict or manipulate the DKG process such that transcripts verify successfully but produce attacker-controlled shared secrets? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/validator_txns/dkg.rs] [Function: process_dkg_result_inner()] [Threshold manipulation] Can the threshold parameters in pub_params at line 101 be manipulated to require fewer honest participants than expected, weakening the BFT security of the DKG protocol? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/validator_txns/dkg.rs] [Function: process_dkg_result_inner()] [Biased randomness] Can malicious validators bias the randomness generated through DKG by submitting specially crafted transcripts that verify but produce predictable or manipulable shared random values?
